result.execSummary:
The defendant Candy M Rex was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/DNA Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 7/1/2016 or penalty of 3 days Huber for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Candy M Rex

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Candy M Rex in court with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Dorlack makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:

FINE: $379.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00  WAIVED
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 7/1/2016.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 3 days in Huber.

Prior: P.O. Box 651, Waukesha, WI 53187-0651 United States
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph James Dorlack in court.   Defendant Candy M Rex did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dorlack advises his client is under a protective place order and placed in a group home.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
